article.headline: South Carolina St 64, Bethune Cookman 38
article.story: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla. (AP) -- Thurman Zimmerman scored 13 points and Brian Mason added 12 to lead South Carolina State to an easy 64-38 victory over Bethune-Cookman in a Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference game Saturday. Bethune-Cookman trailed 37-28 at halftime, but shot only 13.6 percent from the field in the second half, managing only three baskets and four free throws during the final 20 minutes. SCSU started the second half with a 10-3 run that put the Bulldogs up by 16 points, 47-31, with 11:35 to play. Mason later led a 15-0 run with six points, giving SCSU a 62-33 lead with 4:10 left. Bethune-Cookman shot only 23.1 percent from the field for the game. The 10-point second half was the lowest output in a half by a Wildcat team since scoring only 12 points during a 70-26 loss at Nebraska on Dec. 20, 2003. Michael Williams and Nicholas Berry led Bethune-Cookman with eight points apiece. The win, only the second for SCSU in its last eight games, improved the Bulldogs' record to 9-8 overall and 3-4 in league play. Bethune-Cookman (6-10, 3-4 MEAC) lost its fourth straight.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
